Description: Upper body sherd of pottery globular aryballos with mouth and handle; upper parts reserved; on shoulder a narrow band above a broader glazed area.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is badly burnt on its surface from bombing in WWII. 'NAUKRATIS' written in ink on handle.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.059)
